byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and MICHAEL R. GORDON

abstract: Russia seeks permission under Open Skies Treaty to fly surveillance planes equipped with high-powered digital cameras over United States; treaty's goal is to foster transparency about military activity between nations, especially in Europe, but request leaves military officials wondering whether Moscow is exploiting treaty to gather intelligence on critical infrastructure in US, including power plants and communications networks.
lead_paragraph: Russia has requested to upgrade the cameras it uses on sanctioned surveillance flights across the United States, which are part of a treaty.

headline.main: Russia Wants Closer Look From Above the U.S.
headline.print_headline: Russia Wants Closer Look From Above the U.S.

snippet: Russia has requested to upgrade the cameras it uses on sanctioned surveillance flights across the United States, which are part of a treaty.
